inclusion.criterion: Any Case Of Acute Abdominal Pain
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: suspected to be surgical cases in adults
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: The patient have severe cardiac or respiratory disease ,cant to lie supine
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: If suspected medical case of acute abdomen
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 17-year-old boy with severe migratory pain in the right lower quadrant of his abdomen, nausea and vomiting, fever, tenderness, rebound tenderness, guarding on palpation, elevated WBC, dominant neutrophils, CT scan showing acute perforated appendicitis, diagnostic laparoscopy revealing phlegmon. Candidate for emergent laparoscopic appendectomy under general anesthesia.
